intro: Lippia rosella, commonly known as purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and produces small, four-lobed leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Lippia rosella is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
